reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic abbrev-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (topic equation-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic mathml-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic svg-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)
reference.title: Armv8 Debug UNPREDICTABLE behaviors
reference.shortdesc: This section describes the behavior that the Cortex‑A76 core implements when:

ul.li: A topic has multiple options.
The behavior differs from either or both of the Options and Preferences behaviors.

section.note: This section does not describe the behavior when a topic only has a single option and the core implements the preferred behavior.

row.entry: Scenario
Behavior
A32 BKPT instruction with condition code not AL

entry.p: The core implements the following preferred option:

ul.li: Executed unconditionally.

row.entry: Address match breakpoint match only on second halfword of an instruction
The core generates a breakpoint on the instruction if CPSR.IL=0. In the case of CPSR.IL=1, the core does not generate a breakpoint exception.
Address matching breakpoint on A32 instruction with DBGBCRn.BAS=1100

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: Does match if CPSR.IL=0.

row.entry: Address match breakpoint match on T32 instruction at DBGBCRn+2 with DBGBCRn.BAS=1111

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: Does match.

row.entry: Link to non-existent breakpoint or breakpoint that is not context-aware

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: No Breakpoint or Watchpoint debug event is generated, and the LBN field of the linker reads unknown.

row.entry: DBGWCRn_EL1.MASK!=00000 and DBGWCRn_EL1.BAS!=11111111

entry.p: The core behaves as indicated in the sole Preference:

ul.li: DBGWCRn_EL1.BAS is ignored and treated as if 11111111.

row.entry: Address match breakpoint with DBGBCRn_EL1.BAS=0000

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: As if disabled.

row.entry: DBGWCRn_EL1.BAS specifies a non-contiguous set of bytes within a double-word

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: A Watchpoint debug event is generated for each byte.

row.entry: A32 HLT instruction with condition code not AL

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: Executed unconditionally.

row.entry: Execute instruction at a given EL when the corresponding EDECCR bit is 1 and Halting is allowed

entry.p: The core behaves as follows:

ul.li: Generates debug event and Halt no later than the instruction following the next Context Synchronization operation (CSO) excluding ISB instruction.

row.entry: H > N or H = 0 at Non-secure EL1 and EL0, including value read from PMCR_EL0.N

entry.p: The core implements:

li.p: A simple implementation where all of HPMN[4:0] are implemented, and In Non-secure EL1 and EL0:

ul.li: If H > N then M = N.
If H = 0 then M = 0.

row.entry: H > N or H = 0: value read back in MDCR_EL2.HPMN

entry.p: The core implements:

ul.li: A simple implementation where all of HPMN[4:0] are implemented and for reads of MDCR_EL2.HPMN, return H.

row.entry: P ≥ M and P ≠ 31: reads and writes of PM XEVTYPER_EL0 and PMXEVCNTR_EL0

entry.p: The core implements:

ul.li: A simple implementation where all of SEL[4:0] are implemented, and if P ≥ M and P ≠ 31 then the register is res0.

row.entry: P ≥ M and P ≠ 31: value read in PMSELR_EL0.SEL

entry.p: The core implements:

ul.li: A simple implementation where all of SEL[4:0] are implemented, and if P ≥ M and P ≠ 31 then the register is res0.

row.entry: P = 31: reads and writes of PMXEVCNTR_EL0

entry.p: The core implements:

ul.li: res0.

row.entry: n ≥ M: Direct access to PMEVCNTRn_EL0 and PMEVTYPERn_EL0

entry.p: The core implements:

ul.li: If n ≥ N, then the instruction is unallocated.
Otherwise if n ≥ M, then the register is res0.

row.entry: Exiting Debug state while instruction issued through EDITR is in flight

entry.p: The core implements the following option:

ul.li: The instruction completes in Debug state before executing the restart.

row.entry: Using memory-access mode with a non-word-aligned address

entry.p: The core behaves as indicated in the sole Preference:

ul.li: Does unaligned accesses, faulting if these are not permitted for the memory type.

row.entry: Access to memory-mapped registers mapped to Normal memory

entry.p: The core behaves as indicated in the sole Preference:

ul.li: The access is generated, and accesses might be repeated, gathered, split or resized, in accordance with the rules for Normal memory, meaning the effect is unpredictable.

row.entry: Not word-sized accesses or (AArch64 only) doubleword-sized accesses >

entry.p: The core behaves as indicated in the sole Preference:

ul.li: Reads occur and return unknown data.
Writes set the accessed register(s) to unknown.

row.entry: External debug write to register that is being reset

entry.p: The core behaves as indicated in the sole Preference:

ul.li: Takes reset value.

row.entry: Accessing reserved debug registers

entry.p: The core deviates from preferred behavior because the hardware cost to decode some of these addresses in debug power domain is significantly high.
The actual behavior is:

ol.li:
For reserved debug registers in the address range 000-CFC and Performance Monitors registers in the address range 000, the response is either constrained unpredictable Error or res0 when any of the following errors occurs:
Off The core power domain is either completely off or in a low-power state where the core power domain registers cannot be accessed.
DLK DoubleLockStatus() is TRUE and OS double-lock is locked (EDPRSR.DLK is 1).
OSLK OS lock is locked (OSLSR_EL1.OSLK is 1).

For reserved debug registers in the address ranges 400-4FC and 800-8FC, the response is constrained unpredictable Error or res0 when the conditions in 1 do not apply and the following error occurs:
EDAD AllowExternalDebugAccess() is FALSE. External debug access is disabled.

For reserved Performance Monitor registers in the address ranges 000-0FC and 400-47C, the response is either constrained unpredictable Error, or res0 when the conditions in 1 and 2 do not apply, and the following error occurs:
EPMAD AllowExternalPMUAccess() is FALSE. External Performance Monitors access is disabled.

row.entry: Clearing the clear-after-read EDPRSR bits when Core power domain is on, and DoubleLockStatus() is TRUE

entry.p: The core behaves as indicated in the sole Preference:

li.p: Bits are not cleared to zero.
